# Shopping Cart App

## Overview

This is a Shopping Cart application built with React, TypeScript, and Vite. The application features two main pages:

1. <strong>Products Page:</strong> Displays the list of available products.
2. <strong>Cart Page:</strong> Shows the products added to the cart and allows for their removal and quantity adjustments.

Technologies Used

- React
  <img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/he/a/a7/React-icon.svg" width="124px" height="124px">

- Typescript
  <img src = "data:image/png;base64," height = "124px" width = "124px">

- Vite
  <img src = "https://vitejs.dev/logo-with-shadow.png" height = "124px" width = "124px">

- NodeJS
  <img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Node.js_logo.svg" width="124px" height="124px">

- CSS Modules

<img src="data:image/png;base64," width="124px" height="124px">

### Prerequisites

### Installation

1. git clone https://github.com/roy845/ShoppingCartReactTypescript.git

2. Navigate into the project directory:
   cd shopping-cart-app

3. Install the dependencies:
   npm install

### Running the Application

To run the application in development mode, execute:
npm run dev

### Features

### Products Page

- Displays a list of products with their details (name, price, and description).
- Allows users to add products to the cart.

<a href="https://ibb.co/dmJwc0y"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/XYkr4ZT/Products-screen.png" alt="Products-screen" border="0"></a>

### Cart Page

- Shows the products in the cart with their details (name, price, and quantity).
- Allows for the removal of items from the cart.
- Enables the modification of product quantities in the cart.
- Shows the total price of the products in the cart
- allows to place an order (delete all the products in the cart and shows an appropriate message)

<a href="https://ibb.co/Tqjk1fx"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/dJCrtTw/Cart-screen.png" alt="Cart-screen" border="0"></a>

- after clicked on place order

<a href="https://ibb.co/wKdZBr4"><img src="https://i.ibb.co/SK6D57B/place-order-screen.png" alt="place-order-screen" border="0"></a>
